dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think digital banking is just about convenience, but actually it's reshaping entire national economies, like in Kazakhstan with Halyk Bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think digital banking is just about convenience, but actually it's reshaping entire national economies, like in Kazakhstan with Halyk Bank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President was updated on the results of Kaspi.kz and its plans to create new services to help develop small and medium-sized businesses in the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the Prime Minister was just briefed on their results. I mean, seven thousand domestic entrepreneurs are using Halyk's tech to develop their businesses. That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the Prime Minister was just briefed on their results. I mean, seven thousand domestic entrepreneurs are using Halyk's tech to develop their businesses. That's a huge number.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President was updated on the results of Kaspi.kz and its plans to create new services to help develop small and medium-sized businesses in the country. According to the information presented to the Head of State, today about 700 thousand domestic entrepreneurs are developing their businesses using technologies from Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the scale of transactions is massive too—1.2 trillion tenge in cash payments in just the first half of 2024. That's… uh, a staggering amount of economic activity flowing through one bank's systems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the scale of transactions is massive toominus one point two trillion tenge in cash payments in just the first half of twenty twenty four. That's... uh, a staggering amount of economic activity flowing through one bank's systems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not all growth, you know? They also had fifteen thousand individual entrepreneurs deregistered in that same period. Makes you wonder what's behind that shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not all growth, you know? They also had fifteen thousand individual entrepreneurs deregistered in that same period. Makes you wonder what's behind that shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then there's the collaboration with government—like, paying salaries on time through online services. Over 110 billion tenge in taxes processed that way. It's almost like the bank is becoming part of public infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then there's the collaboration with government-like, paying salaries on time through online services. Over one hundred ten billion tenge in taxes processed that way. It's almost like the bank is becoming part of public infrastructure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis can pay taxes on time using online services created jointly between Kaspi.kz and the relevant government departments. Over the first 6 months of 2024, more than 1.1 trillion tenge in taxes and other payments to the budget were made in this way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, which is probably why the Prime Minister expressed reservations to Halyk Bank shareholders. When a private entity gets that enmeshed with state functions, oversight becomes critical.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, which is probably why the Prime Minister expressed reservations to Halyk Bank shareholders. When a private entity gets that enmeshed with state functions, oversight becomes critical.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance of further assistance to small and medium-sized businesses in Kazakhstan and in this regard expressed his support to the shareholders of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially with plans to consolidate large enterprises. That's a lot of power concentrated in very few hands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially with plans to consolidate large enterprises. That's a lot of power concentrated in very few hands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And you've got Vyacheslav Kim from Kaspi.kz in the mix too—another major player. It feels like this is about more than just banking; it's about who controls the economy's backbone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you've got Vyacheslav Kim from the website in the mix too-another major player. It feels like this is about more than just banking; it's about who controls the economy's backbone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vyacheslav Kim, Mikhail Lomtadze (left) at a reception with Kassym-Jomart Tokayev Photo: Aqorda Kazakhstanis can pay taxes on time using online services created jointly between Kaspi.kz and the relevant government departments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. The government wants further control, but they're also reliant on these tech partnerships. It's a delicate balance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. The government wants further control, but they're also reliant on these tech partnerships. It's a delicate balance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And when you see numbers like 1.2 trillion tenge, it's clear why everyone's paying attention. This isn't small change; it's the future of economic management.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And when you see numbers like one point two trillion tenge, it's clear why everyone's paying attention. This isn't small change; it's the future of economic management.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

artist_script:
People think digital banking is just about convenience, but actually it's reshaping entire national economies, like in Kazakhstan with Halyk Bank.
HostB: Right, and the Prime Minister was just briefed on their results. I mean, seven thousand domestic entrepreneurs are using Halyk's tech to develop their businesses. That's a huge number.
HostA: And the scale of transactions is massive too—1.2 trillion tenge in cash payments in just the first half of 2024. That’s… uh, a staggering amount of economic activity flowing through one bank's systems.
HostB: But it’s not all growth, you know? They also had fifteen thousand individual entrepreneurs deregistered in that same period. Makes you wonder what’s behind that shift.
HostA: Yeah, and then there's the collaboration with government—like, paying salaries on time through online services. Over 110 billion tenge in taxes processed that way. It’s almost like the bank is becoming part of public infrastructure.
HostB: Exactly, which is probably why the Prime Minister expressed reservations to Halyk Bank shareholders. When a private entity gets that enmeshed with state functions, oversight becomes critical.
HostA: Especially with plans to consolidate large enterprises. That’s a lot of power concentrated in very few hands.
HostB: And you’ve got Vyacheslav Kim from Kaspi.kz in the mix too—another major player. It feels like this is about more than just banking; it’s about who controls the economy's backbone.
HostA: For sure. The government wants further control, but they’re also reliant on these tech partnerships. It’s a delicate balance.
HostB: Absolutely. And when you see numbers like 1.2 trillion tenge, it’s clear why everyone’s paying attention. This isn’t small change; it’s the future of economic management.
